etymology.description: Depicts a bear: two paws stylized as 匕(匕) (bǐ, "spoon") + face/mouth stylized as 月(月) (yuè, "moon")
etymology.interpretation: The character 能(néng), originally meant to represent a bear, combines elements stylized as paws and a face to visually convey an animal's features. Over time, this depiction of a bear has lent its phonetic value to words associated with ability and energy.

examples.chinese: 这座桥能承受大风(這座橋能承受大風)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò qiáo néng chéngshòu dà fēng.
examples.english: This bridge can bear strong winds.

examples.chinese: 他能承受巨大压力(他能承受巨大壓力)。
这台电脑能运行复杂程序(這台電腦能運行複雜程序)，满足现代需求(滿足現代需求)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tái diànnǎo néng yùnxíng fùzá chéngxù, mǎnzú xiàndài xūqiú.
examples.english: This computer can run complex programs, meeting modern needs.
